attributes.comment:
As legal immigrants to this great country, my family has been following the laws
of the United States of America every step of the way. However, it seems unjust
that illegal immigrants are getting green cards earlier than us, because like 1
million plus people out there, we are stuck in the black hole called FBI
background check. Our case has been out of the time frame for 3 years, and yet
USCIS and FBI refuse to do a thing about it. I believe the constitution grants
everyone due process, citizen or not. And now the fee increase?! The inability
of the USCIS to do their jobs translates to higher cost to us legal immigrants
who has done nothing wrong except for following the immigration law? Does that
make sense to anyone?
Six hours of the cost of the Iraqi war, if diverted to USCIS, would save
millions of us who are living in agony because of the backlog of USCIS, yet the
congress refuse to increase the budget for the FBI background checking program.
And now we are expected to pick up the slack? When we have been treated so
unfairly by the USCIS?! It is an outrage and someone should be held responsibile,
Please. I am appealing to your empathy and common sense. Think if you are in our
shoes, how would you feel?

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
